isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 18 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RTLO-14618 AND RTLO-16618 SERIES - REASSEMBLE - SHIFTER HOUSING

step1.para: If previously removed, install the reverse-stop plunger in the LO-Reverse shift yoke, making sure the plunger is fully seated in the yoke slot bore ( Figure 149).

figure.caption: Figure 149. Install Reverse-Stop Plunger in LO-Reverse Shift Yoke

step1.para: Install the spring in the yoke bore and on the plunger shank ( Figure 150).

figure.caption: Figure 150. Install Spring in Yoke Bore and on Plunger Shank

step1.para: Install the plug and tighten to compress the spring (left, Figure 151). Back the plug out 1 to 1 1/2 turns and stake the plug through the small hole in the yoke (right).

figure.caption: Figure 151. Install Plug and Tighten, Then Stake Plug Through Hole in Yoke

step1.para: Secure the shifter housing in a vise. Hold the notched-end of the short LO-Reverse speed shift bar and install the bar in the lower bore of the shifter housing bosses ( Figure 152). Install the yoke lockscrew, tighten and wire securely

figure.caption: Figure 152. Install LO-Reverse Speed Shift Bar in Lower Bore

caution.para: Keep bars in the neutral position during installation. DO NOT EXCEED the recommended torque ratings for yoke lockscrews as overtightening may distort the shift bars.

step1.para: While holding the plunger shank, install the actuating plunger in the center boss bore ( Figure 153).

figure.caption: Figure 153. Install Actuating Plunger in Center Boss Bore

step1.para: Install one 3/4 inch interlock ball in the rear boss top bore ( Figure 154). This ball rides between LO-Reverse and 1st-2nd speed shift bars.

figure.caption: Figure 154. Install Interlock Ball in Rear Boss Top Bore

step1.para: While holding the notched end of the bar, install the 1st-2nd speed shift bar in the housing boss middle bore ( Figure 155). Position the shift block on the bar between the center and rear bosses, and the yoke on the bar between the front and center bosses, long hub to the housing front. Just before inserting the notched end of the rear boss bar, install the small interlock pin VERTICALLY in the neutral notch bore. Install the block and yoke lockscrews, tighten to 35 to 45 ft-lbs. (47 to 61 N·m), and lockwire securely.

figure.caption: Figure 155. Install 1st-2nd Speed Shift Bar in Housing Boss Middle Bore

note.para: It is necessary that the interlock pin remain in a vertical position during reassembly as rotation of the bar causes the pin to jam in the tension spring bores.

step1.para: Install the other 3/4 inch interlock ball in the rear boss top bore ( Figure 156). This ball rides between the 1st-2nd and the 3rd-4th speed shift bars.

figure.caption: Figure 156. Install Other Interlock Ball in Rear Boss Top Bore

step1.para: While holding the notched end of the bar, install the 3rd-4th speed shift bar in the housing boss upper bore and position the shift block on the bar between the front and center bosses, long hub to the housing rear ( Figure 157). Install the block and yoke lockscrews, tighten to 35 to 45 ft-lbs. (47 to 61 N·m), and lockwire securely.
For models so equipped, install the oil trough on the housing. Tighten the bolts to 35 to 45 ft-lbs. (47 to 61 N·m) and lockwire securely.
Remove the assembly from the vise. Install the three tension balls, one in each bore on the housing top ( Figure 158).
Install the three tension springs, one over each ball in the housing bores ( Figure 159).
